snippet: Pegida, whose weekly rallies in Dresden have attracted as many as 25,000 people, called off Monday’s rally, citing a terrorist threat to its leader.
abstract: Rally organized by anti-immigration group Pegida in Dresden, Germany, is canceled after terrorist threat is leveled against movement's leader Lutz Bachmann; country is grappling with swelling anti-immigration and anti-Muslim sentiment.
lead_paragraph: Pegida, whose weekly rallies in Dresden have attracted as many as 25,000 people, called off Monday’s rally, citing a terrorist threat to its leader.

headline.main: German Anti-Immigrant Rally Canceled as Leader Is Threatened
headline.print_headline: German Anti-Immigrant Rally Canceled as Leader Is Threatened
